summary: This is an email chain from October 25, 2019, within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, discussing a New York Post article. The article reports on an interview with former mobster Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, who comments on Jeffrey Epstein's death and criticizes former President Bill Clinton's association with Epstein.

persons.name: Salvatore Gravano
persons.context: Former Gambino crime family mobster, known as "Sammy the Bull," who was interviewed about Jeffrey Epstein's death. He expresses his opinion that Epstein killed himself and criticizes Bill Clinton.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased financier and accused sex trafficker whose death in prison is discussed by Salvatore Gravano in the referenced interview.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Former President mentioned by Gravano as someone who associated with Jeffrey Epstein. Gravano criticizes him, alluding to the Monica Lewinsky affair.

persons.name: John Gotti
persons.context: Former Gambino crime family boss whom Salvatore Gravano testified against in 1992.

persons.name: Emily Saul
persons.context: Co-author of the New York Post article being discussed in the email.

persons.name: Kate Sheehy
persons.context: Co-author of the New York Post article being discussed in the email.

persons.name: Monica Lewinsky
persons.context: Mentioned in the article as the intern with whom President Bill Clinton had an affair, referenced by Gravano in his criticism.

connections.description: Gravano was a high-ranking member of the Gambino crime family under boss John Gotti before testifying against him.
Gravano references that Clinton chose to associate with Epstein, implying a social connection.
The document references Clinton's affair with White House intern Monica Lewinsky.

events.title: New York Post article published
events.description: The New York Post publishes an article titled "Mob rat 'Sammy the Bull' Gravano talks about Jeffrey Epstein," featuring an interview with Salvatore Gravano.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died in August 2019 while in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in Manhattan.

events.title: Gravano testifies against Gotti
events.description: Salvatore Gravano testifies against his Mafia boss, John Gotti, helping to convict him.

events.title: Death of John Gotti
events.description: John Gotti dies while still in prison.

events.title: Gravano released from prison
events.description: Salvatore Gravano is released from prison after serving nearly 18 years for drug-peddling.

locations: 9 South (wing at the Metropolitan Correctional Center)
keyFacts: Salvatore 'Sammy the Bull' Gravano, a former high-ranking mobster, gave an interview stating he believes Jeffrey Epstein killed himself in prison and was not murdered.
Gravano expressed disgust that prominent figures like former President Bill Clinton associated with Epstein.
The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York discussing a media article about Epstein.
Gravano referenced his own time in the same prison wing ('9 South') at the Metropolitan Correctional Center where Epstein died.
The email highlights public and media speculation surrounding Epstein's death and his associations.
